channel.title: Teaching on Vincent Armentano
channel.description: Recent content in Teaching on Vincent Armentano

item.title: Courses
item.description: Machine Learning for Causal Inference with R Syllabus and content forthcoming.

item.title: TA Work
item.description: ECON1: Principles of Microeconomics, Fall 2021 Each week of the ten week quarter I held an discussion section reviewing course content and helping students perform practice problems. I also held office hours, helped create exam questions and helped ensure lectures ran smoothly by answering questions in the lecture hall and on discord. ECON3: Principles of Macroeconomics, Winter 2022 For this course I specialized in covering topics of inflation and monetary policy for discussion sections.

item.title: Extracurricular Service
item.description: Service outside of the classroom is something very important to me. Wherever possible I hope to foster a love of economics in students and see extracurriculuars as a great way to do that. Graduate Student Research Seminar (GSRS) The Graduate Student Research Seminar (GSRS) is a weekly seminar for graduate students to present ongoing works to other graduate students. Alongside one other student, I help organize this seminar series each quarter.
